intro: Ischaemum ramosissimum, commonly known as the hairy oatgrass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with two to three florets, typical of the Poaceae family. It is native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Ischaemum ramosissimum is typically perennial and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm.
